frameDefinitions: The Focal_feature is defined in relation to a Landmark_feature, either as a particular part, or as an immediately bordering entity.
A Self-moving Escapee departs from an Undesirable_location.
A Self_mover intentionally moves in a Directionon a Path relative to landmark that is neither the Source nor the Goal of the overall motion.
This frame contains words that describe a Boundary between two Entities.
A Group is described as having members which are similar or dissimilar to each other.
An Agent or Cause causes an Entity to change, either in its category membership or in terms of the value of an Attribute.
frameExamples: I'm on the <t>summit</t> of Mt. Shasta.
Ambrose Powell <t>forded</t> over on one horse, and we drove the others after him.
The canyon is the <t>border</t> between the two states.
The <t>diversity</t> of students here is to be applauded . INI
Our storylines follows the saga outlined by the Ultima Series, but we have <t>modified</t> it in order to make our writing more cohesive.
listRoleDefinitions: A stable bounded area defined by its relation to another landform. This role is incorporated in each LU in this frame.
The landform with respect to which the <fen>Focal_feature</fen> is defined.
The <fen>Escapee</fen> manages to leave the <fen>Undesirable_location</fen>.
The <fex name='Undesirable_location'>Undesirable_location</fex> is where the Escapee begins.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the escaping occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the Escaping occurs.
This is a sentient being or a vehicle steered by a sentient being which moves.
Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Source</fen>.
Any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen> expresses the frame element <fen>Path</fen>, excluding directional expressions:
Any expression which indicates where the <fen>Self_mover</fen> ends up as a result of the motion expresses the frame element <fen>Goal</fen>.
The configuration formed by the entire <fen>Path</fen> of the <fen>Self_mover</fen>, taken simultaneously.
The direction in which the <fen>Self_mover</fen> goes.
The time at which the motion takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the motion (which is specified by a <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen>) is located.
The region which is between the Entities or between the Entity and empty space.
The entity that has a <fen>Boundary</fen>.
The joint construal of both <fen>Entities</fen> next to the <fen>Boundary</fen>.
This role marks constituents that express the set of objects or types whose diversity is at issue.
This role marks constituents which express a property in respect to which the similarity of the <fen>Group</fen> is assessed.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the Group is diverse or homogenous.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the general area in which diversity occurs or exists.
The sentient entity that effects a change in the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The category of which the <fen>Entity</fen> is a member before the <fen>Agent</fen> causes a change.
The category that the <fen>Entity</fen> belongs to after it has undergone the change.
The value that the <fen>Attribute</fen> assumes as a result of the change that the <fen>Entity</fen> is caused to undergo.
The value that the <fen>Attribute</fen> has before the change takes place.
A characteristic of the <fen>Entity</fen> for which a value can be assigned or determined by calculation, measurement , or observation.
The abstract or concrete thing or situation that the <fen>Agent</fen> causes to change.
An event that causes a change in the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The time at which the change of the <fen>Entity</fen> is caused.
The location where the change of the <fen>Entity</fen> is caused.
listRoleExamples: <fex>We</fex> drive down dusty roads, forded through a stream, and tried to get up a mountainside on a rocky road.
We forded <fex>from the island</fex> to the mainland.
We decided to cut <fex>through the forest</fex>.
I'll cut across the Sahara desert <fex>up to Algeria and Morocco</fex>.
We followed the trail (which is well marked with cairns) and then cut <fex>west</fex> across a grassy meadow for about 1000 feet to the crest of  the nearby saddle lying below North Peak.
The Federal Army of the Potomac forded the river <fex>in August 1862</fex>.
The common brook is best forded <fex>south of the hut</fex>.
<fex>The system administrator</fex> changed the value from 'KDE' to 'GNOME', and then restarted the system.
Her time with the Healer Craft has changed her <fex>from a shy, nervous young girl</fex> into a confident (almost) young woman
The radical message of the cross transformed Saul of Tarsus and changed him from a persecutor of Christians <fex>to a tender believer</fex>.
We changed the size from 8 1/2x11 <fex>to a larger 11 x 17</fex> and gave it a complete graphical makeover.
My dad changed his hair color <fex>from red</fex>  to blue today.
We changed <fex>the price</fex> from $1.26 to $1.27 per pint.
The recent terrorist attacks had changed <fex>the political climate</fex>.
<fex>Major technological innovations</fex> changed the social and economic conditions.
He changed it <fex>after David Bowie told him that only twerps have the same first and last name</fex>.
<fex>In his own room</fex> he had modified nothing.
